si.title: ශ්රී ලාංකික කාන්තාව: ඇය බල ගැන්වාද?
body_lines: කාන්තාවන් සවිබල ගැන්වී සිටින විට, ඒවා ආර්ථිකයට ක්රියාකාරී දායකත්වයක්, වර්ධනය පැදවීම සහ සැමට අවස්ථාවන් නිර්මාණය කරයි

කාන්තා සවිබල ගැන්වීම "අධ්යාපනය, දැනුවත් කිරීම, සාක්ෂරතාවය තුළින් කාන්තාවන්ගේ තත්ත්වය, සමාජයේ සමාන තත්ත්වය, වඩා ජීවනෝපාය," කාන්තාවන්ගේ දෘෂ්ටි කෝණයන් ද ලබා ගැනීම "ලෙස අර්ථ දැක්වේ." එය සමාජ ආර්ථික සංවර්ධනයේ වැදගත් අංගයක් බවට පත්ව ඇත.රට. කාන්තා සවිබල ගැන්වීම ප්රධාන කුළුණු 5 කට වර්ගීකරණය කර ඇත, එනම් සමාජ, අධ්යාපනික, ආර්ථික, දේශපාලන හා මානසික කුළුණු. ඔබ සංඛ්යාලේඛන කිහිපයක් දෙස බැලුවහොත් ශ්රී ලංකාවේ ස්ත්රී පුරුෂ භාවය බෙදා හැරීම 2022 ක කාන්තාවන් 52% ක් වන අතර 47% පිරිමි 47% ක් (ශ්රී ලංකා මහ බැංකුව). The rural female labour force is 32.6% while the female urban labour force is 29.3%. ශ්රම බලකායේ 6.5% ක්ම එකම වර්ෂයේ රැකියා විරහිතයන් ලෙස වර්ගීකරණය කර ඇත. Out of the total number of persons who migrated for foreign employment, 40% are females of whom 23.8% have migrated as housemaids.

Urban and rural women face numerous issues in Sri Lanka, key amongst them being gender-based violence, inadequate healthcare, threats to their reproductive rights, lack of education, unequal pay, racial injustice, food insecurities, and poor mental health. Rural women specifically have to face different obstacles such as limited job opportunities, lacking access to physical markets, lacking financial literacy, and lacking opportunities for training according to research done by IPS. Lacking financial literacy (e.g. dealing with banks and other financial institutions) is a common obstacle for urban low-income earners as well. Furthermore, the burden of looking after the elderly and children, fall on the women of the household.

When one analyses this data, we cannot be happy that the Sri Lankan woman is fully empowered. She may have come a long way during the past several decades, however the progress that she has achieved is not adequate.

ශ්රී ලංකා පාර්ලිමේන්තුවේ කාන්තාවන්ගේ දේශපාලන නියෝජනය අසතුටුදායක ය. ස්වීඩනයේ කාන්තාවන් රටේ පාර්ලිමේන්තු මන්ත්රීවරුන්ගෙන් අඩකට ආසන්න ප්රමාණයක් වන අතර අමාත්යාංශවලින් 47.8% ක් පමණ කාන්තාවන් විසින් මෙහෙයවනු ලැබේ. Even though we currently have a lady prime minister, in most of the corporate sectors males dominate.
Gender equality is positive according to some indices in Sri Lanka; however, we have a long way to go to achieve gender parity.

අඩු ආදායම්ලාභීන්ගේ කාන්තාවන් තම ස්වාමිපුරුෂයන් හෝ පුතුන් විසින් හිරිහැර කරනු ලබන විට, ඔවුන්ගේ දුක්ගැනවිලි වාතය වාදනය කිරීමට ඔවුන්ට නිසි ස්ථානයක් නොමැත. මත්පැන් සහ මත්ද්රව්ය ඔවුන්ගේ පවුල් ජීවිතය විසුරුවා හරියි. The Government should listen to their grievances and find suitable solutions. Domestic violence should be stopped at any cost.

In general, solutions to some of the above issues would be having inclusive Government policies, access to justice and promoting women’s leadership at all levels of society. Mentorship programs, skill development also should be designed and made accessible to women.  Rural and urban low-income families should have access to societies, and community women-based organisations with a link to the Government and policymakers. පොලිස් ස්ථානයක් හැරුණු විට ඔවුන්ගේ දුක්ගැනවිලි හ voice හ voice කිරීමට බලයක් තිබිය යුතුය.

Globally, there are countries which are best for women to live and work where women empowerment takes centre-stage. Iceland scores high with its women’s participation in corporate management, national gender gap, access to education, or political empowerment with 6 months maternity leave. Norway is also a good example with political empowerment and combined parental leave for 49-weeks. නවසීලන්තය සිය දේශපාලන සවිබල ගැන්වීම සමත් වූ අතර, අධ්යාපන සෑම මට්ටමක් පුරාම අධ්යාපනික ජයග්රහණයේ ස්ත්රී පුරුෂ පරතරය පියවා ගැනීමට සමත් විය.

When women are empowered, they become active contributors to the economy, driving growth and creating opportunities for all. Women also offer unique insights and approaches that can lead to innovative solutions. Thus, with the empowerment of women, the whole country is empowered.
(ලේඛකයා මහජන උපදේශකයෙකු සහ කෙලනියා විශ්ව විද්යාලයේ උපාධිධාරියෙකි.)

ta.title: The Sri Lankan woman: Is she empowered?
body_lines: When women are empowered, they become active contributors to the economy, driving growth and creating opportunities for all

Women empowerment is defined as “raising the status of women through education, awareness, literacy, equal status in society, better livelihood, and also accepting women’s viewpoints as well”, and it has become a significant aspect of the socio-economic development of a country. பெண்கள் அதிகாரம் 5 முக்கிய தூண்களாக வகைப்படுத்தப்பட்டுள்ளது, அதாவது சமூக, கல்வி, பொருளாதார, அரசியல் மற்றும் உளவியல் தூண்கள். If you look at some statistics Sri Lanka’s gender distribution is 52% females and 47% males in 2022 (Central Bank of Sri Lanka). கிராமப்புற பெண் தொழிலாளர் படை 32.6%, பெண் நகர்ப்புற தொழிலாளர் சக்தி 29.3%. Of the labour force, 6.5% of females are categorised as unemployed in the same year. Out of the total number of persons who migrated for foreign employment, 40% are females of whom 23.8% have migrated as housemaids.

நகர்ப்புற மற்றும் கிராமப்புற பெண்கள் இலங்கையில் ஏராளமான பிரச்சினைகளை எதிர்கொள்கின்றனர், அவற்றில் முக்கியமானது பாலின அடிப்படையிலான வன்முறை, போதிய சுகாதாரப் பாதுகாப்பு, அவர்களின் இனப்பெருக்க உரிமைகளுக்கு அச்சுறுத்தல்கள், கல்வியின் பற்றாக்குறை, சமமற்ற ஊதியம், இன அநீதி, உணவு பாதுகாப்பின்மை மற்றும் மோசமான மனநலம். Rural women specifically have to face different obstacles such as limited job opportunities, lacking access to physical markets, lacking financial literacy, and lacking opportunities for training according to research done by IPS. Lacking financial literacy (e.g. dealing with banks and other financial institutions) is a common obstacle for urban low-income earners as well. Furthermore, the burden of looking after the elderly and children, fall on the women of the household.

இந்தத் தரவை ஒருவர் பகுப்பாய்வு செய்யும் போது, ​​இலங்கை பெண் முழுமையாக அதிகாரம் பெற்றதில் நாம் மகிழ்ச்சியடைய முடியாது. She may have come a long way during the past several decades, however the progress that she has achieved is not adequate.

Political representation of women in the Sri Lankan parliament is unsatisfactory. In Sweden, women make up nearly half of the country’s parliamentarians while around 47.8% of the ministries are headed by women. Even though we currently have a lady prime minister, in most of the corporate sectors males dominate.
இலங்கையில் சில குறியீடுகளின்படி பாலின சமத்துவம் நேர்மறையானது;இருப்பினும், பாலின சமத்துவத்தை அடைய எங்களுக்கு நீண்ட தூரம் செல்ல வேண்டியிருக்கிறது.

When women in low-income households get harassed by their husbands or sons, they have no proper place to air their grievances. Alcohol and drugs disintegrate their family life. The Government should listen to their grievances and find suitable solutions. வீட்டு வன்முறை எந்த விலையிலும் நிறுத்தப்பட வேண்டும்.

பொதுவாக, மேற்கூறிய சில சிக்கல்களுக்கான தீர்வுகள் அரசாங்கக் கொள்கைகளை உள்ளடக்கிய, நீதிக்கான அணுகல் மற்றும் சமூகத்தின் அனைத்து மட்டங்களிலும் பெண்களின் தலைமையை ஊக்குவிப்பதும் ஆகும். வழிகாட்டல் திட்டங்கள், திறன் மேம்பாடு வடிவமைக்கப்பட்டு பெண்களுக்கு அணுகக்கூடியதாக இருக்க வேண்டும்.கிராமப்புற மற்றும் நகர்ப்புற குறைந்த வருமானம் கொண்ட குடும்பங்கள் சமூகங்களுக்கான அணுகல் மற்றும் சமூக பெண்கள் சார்ந்த அமைப்புகளுக்கு அரசாங்கம் மற்றும் கொள்கை வகுப்பாளர்களுடனான தொடர்பைக் கொண்டிருக்க வேண்டும். There should be an authority to voice their grievances other than a police station.

Globally, there are countries which are best for women to live and work where women empowerment takes centre-stage. Iceland scores high with its women’s participation in corporate management, national gender gap, access to education, or political empowerment with 6 months maternity leave. Norway is also a good example with political empowerment and combined parental leave for 49-weeks. New Zealand, with its political empowerment managed to bridge the gender gap in educational attainment across all levels of education.

When women are empowered, they become active contributors to the economy, driving growth and creating opportunities for all. Women also offer unique insights and approaches that can lead to innovative solutions. Thus, with the empowerment of women, the whole country is empowered.
(எழுத்தாளர் பி.ஆர் ஆலோசகர் மற்றும் கெலானியா பல்கலைக்கழகத்தில் பட்டதாரி ஆவார்.)
